page.title: 16Amenities in Charnwood
page.content: All houses have electricity,most have mains water and soakaway cesspits emptied annually.The exception an adopted scheme covers part of Copt Oak installed when the M1 was built.Refuse collection weekly.No North Sea Gas is laid so heating is by other means.Milk is delivered 3 times a week but residents have to travel out of the area for shopping there being{no shops The one public phone box is in Copt Oak so a private phone is essential. Papers & post are delivered daily,the Copt Oak post box is emptied twice a day.Families share the Sunday paper collection.2 radio masts at Copt Oak dominate the skyline British Telecom use one as part of the national network the other is used by utility services for internal radio messages, activating water pumping,electricity substations,checking floods.
